settings.heading: Twigg's Jamaican Patty with a Grace Peanut Punch
settings.text: First up, we have Twigg's choice for a guilty pleasure: a classic Jamaican patty accompanied by a Grace Peanut Punch. Jamaican patties are known for their flaky pastry filled with seasoned meat or vegetables. The combination with Grace Peanut Punch, a sweet and nutty beverage, creates a tantalizing blend of savoury and sweet that transports Twigg's taste buds to the sunny shores of the Caribbean, right in the heart of Toronto.
settings.fun-fact: Twigg didn't give us a favourite location, but this list from BlogTO is pretty solid.

settings.heading: Maddie's Caledonian Mac & Cheese with a Deep Fried Mars Bar
settings.text: Maddie's comfort food of choice is the Caledonia Mac & Cheese, a creamy, cheesy delight that's a classic in comfort cuisine. But she takes it a step further by enjoying it alongside a deep-fried Mars bar. The result is a perfect harmony of rich, cheesy pasta and a crispy, sweet treat. It's a comforting guilty pleasure that's sure to put a smile on your face.
settings.fun-fact: 856 College Street, Toronto, Ontario M6H 1A2, Canada

settings.heading: Brian's Sneaky Dee's Nachos with Extra Cheese and Well Done
settings.text: Brian's guilty pleasure is all about Sneaky Dee's Nachos, a Toronto icon known for their generous toppings and incredible flavour. Brian loves to load them up with extra cheese and have them cooked until they're well done, ensuring every chip is perfectly crispy and the cheese is melted to gooey perfection. It's a nacho lover's paradise.
settings.fun-fact: 431 College St, Toronto, ON M5T 1T1, Canada

settings.heading: Binh An's Swiss Chalet Half Chicken and Half Rack of Ribs
settings.text: Binh An's indulgence of choice is a hearty one: Swiss Chalet's combination of half chicken and half rack of ribs. The succulent chicken and flavourful ribs, coated in Swiss Chalet's signature sauces, create a fulfilling and satisfying meal. It's the ultimate guilty pleasure for anyone with a hankering for rotisserie chicken and BBQ ribs in the city.

settings.heading: Robbie's Congee Queen's Fried Chili Turnip Patties
settings.text: Robbie's go-to guilty pleasure is the Fried Chili Turnip Patties from Congee Queen. These little patties are spicy and crispy, offering a tantalizing blend of flavours and textures. Robbie enjoys them as a spicy and satisfying snack that adds an exciting twist to Toronto's culinary scene.
settings.fun-fact: They have a bunch of locations, check out the website!

settings.heading: Kasumi's kfc 5 piece with gravy
settings.text: Last but not least, Kasumi keeps it simple and satisfying with a classic favourite: a 5 Piece from KFC (Kentucky Fried Chicken) paired with rich and flavourful gravy. The crispy, perfectly seasoned chicken and the savoury gravy is a combo that's hard to resist, even for the staff at Knifewear Toronto.
settings.fun-fact: There is a bunch of them around.

settings.content:
From savoury to sweet, each of these indulgent dishes has a unique flavour to offer, satisfying our cravings and giving us a taste of what Toronto has to bring to the table. Whether you're a local or a visitor, don't miss the opportunity to explore these delightful guilty pleasures and discover your own favourites in this vibrant city.

So, which of these Toronto guilty pleasures would you like to try on your next visit to the city?
